text: Manuel Antonio Noriega MorenoBoyd Marciacq, Carmen. "29, 2007&idnews;=33933 Noriega: el dictador ." El Siglo. Retrieved on January 8, 2010. (11 February 1934 - 29 May 2017) was a Panamanian politician and general. Noriega went to high school and had a career in the army. He was the de facto ruler of Panama between 12 August 1983 and 20 December 1989. In 1992, a United States court convicted him of drug trafficking, racketeering, and money laundering. Noriega served a prison sentence in the US, which ended in 2007. He was then extradited to France, where he served another sentence. A conditional release was given to him on September 23, 2011. Noriega was sent to Panama to serve 20 years. He arrived in Panama on December 11, 2011. Noriega died at a medical center in Panama City on 29 May 2017 from complications of brain surgery at the age of 83. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Drug traffickers Category:Former dictators Category:Generals Category:Heads of state Category:North American military people Category:North American politicians Category:Panamanian politicians Category:People convicted of drug offenses Category:Prisoners Category:Extradition
title: Manuel Noriega
